form_language.hypar.name: Hypar
form_language.hypar.description: A saddle-shaped, double-curved surface (hyperbolic paraboloid) often used as a lightweight shell or canopy.

form_language.vault.name: Vault
form_language.vault.description: A single-direction curved form creating a tunnel-like or barrel-shaped volume.

form_language.peak.name: Peak Form
form_language.peak.description: A shell or volume that converges toward one or more peaks, including dome-like, conical, tent-like, or multi-peaked forms.

form_language.pitched.name: Pitched Form
form_language.pitched.description: A form composed of one or more planar sloping surfaces, such as gable, hip, shed, or simple pavilion-like shapes.

form_language.freeform.name: Freeform
form_language.freeform.description: A smooth, organic, non-rule-based geometry with flowing curves that do not follow a simple vault, peak, pitched, or hypar logic.

form_language.branching.name: Branching
form_language.branching.description: A tree-like or ramified form where multiple elements branch and split, often resembling trunks and canopies.

structure_system.frame.name: Frame Series
structure_system.frame.description: A sequence of similar frames or ribs placed along a direction, forming a tunnel-like or layered structure.

structure_system.truss.name: Truss
structure_system.truss.description: A triangulated structural system where linear members carry mainly axial forces, including planar trusses and 3D space trusses/space frames.

structure_system.gridshell.name: Gridshell
structure_system.gridshell.description: A curved shell structure formed by a lattice grid that bends into shape, combining grid logic with shell behavior.

structure_system.reciprocal.name: Reciprocal Frame
structure_system.reciprocal.description: A system where members mutually support each other in a rotational or ring-like pattern, often forming radial or spiral grids.

connection.binding.name: Binding
connection.binding.description: Connections made using lashings, ropes, rattan, or fiber wraps, relying on friction and confinement around the bamboo.

connection.cutmiter.name: Cut-Miter Joint
connection.cutmiter.description: Connections formed primarily by cutting, carving, or notching the bamboo so that members fit together by shape.

connection.mechanical.name: Mechanical Connector
connection.mechanical.description: Connections that rely on bolts, plates, clamps, brackets, shoes, or similar hardware attached to bamboo members.

connection.node.name: Node System
connection.node.description: Engineered hub or node elements that connect multiple members into a single central component, often for complex 3D geometries.

context.forest.name: Forest
context.forest.description: A quiet, intimate setting surrounded by dense trees or jungle, with a feeling of privacy and immersion in nature.

context.beach.name: Beach Coastal
context.beach.description: A coastal setting with sand, sea or ocean, coastal vegetation, and a strong horizon line.

context.blank.name: Blank Minimal
context.blank.description: A neutral, studio-like environment with minimal or no real-world context, used to emphasize the structure itself.
